org.eclipse.keyple.plugin.remote

Interface RemotePluginServer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.event.ObservablePlugin, org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.Plugin

    public interface RemotePluginServer
extends org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.event.ObservablePlugin
    API of the Remote Plugin Server associated to the Local Service Client.

    This plugin must be registered by the application installed on a Server not having local access to the smart card reader and that wishes to control the reader remotely :

    • To register the plugin, use the method SmartCardService.registerPlugin(PluginFactory) using the factory RemotePluginServerFactory.
    • To access the plugin, use the utility method RemotePluginServerUtils.getRemotePlugin().
    • To unregister the plugin, use the method SmartCardService.unregisterPlugin(String) using the plugin name.

    This plugin behaves like an ObservablePlugin but exposes additional services and contains only RemoteReaderServer and ObservableRemoteReaderServer readers.

    Please note that this plugin is observable only to trigger ticketing services on the server side, but does not allow observation on the local plugin (reader insertion, etc...).

    How to use it ?

    1. Register the plugin.
    2. Subscribe to plugin observation by implementing the interface ObservablePlugin.PluginObserver and using the plugin method ObservablePlugin.addObserver(PluginObserver)
    3. Waiting to be notified of a plugin event of type PluginEvent.EventType#READER_CONNECTED.
    4. Retrieve the name of the first reader contained in the event readers list using the method PluginEvent.getReaderNames().
    5. Retrieve the remote reader from the plugin using the method getReader(String).
    6. If you have activated the observation of the reader events, then you can cast the reader into an ObservableRemoteReaderServer.
    7. Retrieve the service id from the reader using the method RemoteReaderServer.getServiceId().
    8. Execute the ticketing service identified by the service id.
    9. During the ticketing service execution, you can retrieve from the reader the user input data using the method RemoteReaderServer.getUserInputData(Class) and/or the initial smart card content transmitted by the client using the method RemoteReaderServer.getInitialCardContent(Class).
    10. To terminate the remote ticketing service, invoke on the plugin the method terminateService(String, Object) by providing the associated reader name and optionally a user output data.
    Since:
    1.0
